Twinkle Twinkle Lil Star foreshadowed Tony in space and that's the tea.

blog.name: theincorrectavengers
blog.title: ⎊Incorrect Avengers Quotes⎊
blog.description:
Bailey • Canadian • Bisexual

Feel free to send me asks or prompts :)

https://myurls.co/theincorrectavengers

summary:
Peter: *laying facedown on the floor*
Steve: hey kid, you alright?
Peter: Mr. Captain Steve America Rogers sir?
Steve:...
body:
Peter: *laying facedown on the floor*

Steve: hey kid, you alright?

Peter: Mr. Captain Steve America Rogers sir?

Steve: yes?

Peter: no, not really. Death is inevitable, no one can escape it, so there’s really no point in living, whatsoever

[2 hours later]

Bucky, Tony and Strange: *all discussing what to do*

Bucky: and he just laid right down beside Peter and stayed there!

Strange: should we move them?

Tony: no, no, it’s fine. Peter’s just having an existential crisis and sucked Rogers into it

Bucky: ????

Strange: this isn’t normal

Tony: for the kid it is

@theincorrectavengers

by forensicleaf

“So you’re uh - a little heavy handed,” the boy says. “We can work on that.” And then once, twice, he gently pats the mechanical arm quizzically observing him.

The gesture is… good.

“Welcome to the world, buddy,” the boy says. “My name’s Tony.”

(Or: a boy, a bot, and a bond through the years)

summary: [Feb28.19] - Day 57 - Have an RDJ on your dash. TIC - Floopsy mustaches. Hehe, no it’s not that bad. But I didn’t connect it to...
caption:
[Feb28.19] - Day 57 - Have an RDJ on your dash.

TIC -

  1. Floopsy mustaches. Hehe, no it’s not that bad. But I didn’t connect it to make a goatee. But the chin part looks porcupinely awesome.
  2. His eyes are kind of flat.
  3. Definitely could do more with the shading.

What I like -

  1. This took around thirty minutes (?) from start to finish
  2. Even though the shading/highlights are minimal I think I hit the right spots.
  3. Proportions look good (except maybe his magical girl eyes :DDDD)
  4. Open composition!

summary: Hi here I am with a prompt. Imagine Peter as an employee in a high end flower shop. He is all sweet and knows tons about flowers...
question: Hi here I am with a prompt. Imagine Peter as an employee in a high end flower shop. He is all sweet and knows tons about flowers and makes beautiful bouquets. Tony comes in really hurried because he is late to a friend date with Pepper (again) or something and wants to get her something to say sorry.  He was going to just grab some roses when he notices Peter making a bouquet. Naturally he has to tall to this pretty boy. Flirting probably ensues.
answer:
Hello! Thanks so much for this prompt, and I’m sorry it’s taken so long!  I’m just gonna post these prompts HC style, because I’m not really in the writing mood right now.  So anyway, I hope you like this cheesy lil’ bit of fluff.

  • Tony is late again and he already feels terrible.  It’s the fifth time in a row he’s running late meeting Pepper and he doesn’t want it to seem like since they broke up he doesn’t care anymore.

  • He asks Happy to stop the car when he spots an elegant little flower shop on the corner of the block.

  • Flowers, he thinks.  It’ll have to do.

  • “I’ll be five minutes max,” he tells Happy as he jumps out of the car and heads into the flower shop.

  • It’s not too busy inside, and as soon as Tony enters his nostrils are assaulted by the strong smell of plant.

  • He isn’t really much of a plant or flower person, but he knows he has to do something to make up for being late again.

  • He walks around for a bit, conscious of the time, and finally settles on grabbing the nearest bouquet of red roses he can find.

  • He gets to the counter to pay for his flowers, and he is met with the most gorgeous deep brown eyes he has ever seen.

  • It takes him aback; fuck this boy is pretty.

  • The cashier - Peter, as his name badge suggests - is making up a bouquet of flowers, and Tony stares at how his slender fingers move so expertly, how his hands are so steady, how his-

  • “Hello, Sir.  How can I help you today?” Peter asks brightly, breaking Tony out of his staring.

  • Tony wants to get to know him.  No, he needs to.  He eyes Peter up and down and smiles charmingly.  “The bouquet you just made up.  Is it for sale?”

  • Peter glances from Tony to his newly-made bouquet and smiles.  “Yeah,” he says.  “Sure.  It’s $15.”

  • Tony hums and nods.  “I’ll take them.  And these,” he says, placing the roses on the counter.

  • “Of course, Sir,” Peter says, keying things into the till and then carefully picking up his hand-made bouquet and placing it on the counter for Tony.  “Very lucky someone you’ve got at home.”

  • “Oh yeah,” Tony agrees.  “Very lucky.”

  • “That’ll be 24.99 altogether,” Peter says, smiling so sweetly at Tony that Tony thinks his heart might explode.

  • Tony pulls out a 50 dollar bill and hands it to Peter.  “Keep the change,” he says softly. 

  • Peter stares at Tony in shock, which makes Tony smile.  Just as Peter’s about to protest, Tony puts his hand up and cuts in.  “Please, Peter,” he says, watching the boy blush at the use of his name.  “Keep the change.  For the effort of having to make the bouquet.”

  • “Th-thank you.  That’s really nice of you, Sir,” Peter says, cheeks still rosy.  “Let me get your receipt.”

  • “Of course.”

  • When Peter hands the receipt to Tony, Tony pulls a pen out of the pocket of his suit and writes his phone number down on the paper.  He then takes the roses in one hand and slides Peter’s bouquet back across the counter towards Peter.

  • “For you,” Tony grins.  “The most beautiful flowers I’ve ever seen for the most beautiful man I’ve ever seen.”  He slides the receipt across to a blushing, stuttering Peter and winks.  “And now you’ve got my number.  Your move.”

  • “Sir, I-”

  • “-Call me Tony.  Tony Stark,” Tony says with a smile.  “It was lovely meeting you, Peter.  I hope to hear from you soon?” With that, Tony walks towards the door of the shop, feeling thoroughly elated.

  • “Yes, Mr Stark.  You- You will!” he hears Peter call after him.  

  • All in all, a pretty successful day.  And a good reason to be late.

  • All in all, a pretty successful day.  And a good reason to be late.
trail.content:
Hello! Thanks so much for this prompt, and I’m sorry it’s taken so long!  I’m just gonna post these prompts HC style, because I’m not really in the writing mood right now.  So anyway, I hope you like this cheesy lil’ bit of fluff.

  • Tony is late again and he already feels terrible.  It’s the fifth time in a row he’s running late meeting Pepper and he doesn’t want it to seem like since they broke up he doesn’t care anymore.

  • He asks Happy to stop the car when he spots an elegant little flower shop on the corner of the block.

  • Flowers, he thinks.  It’ll have to do.

  • “I’ll be five minutes max,” he tells Happy as he jumps out of the car and heads into the flower shop.

  • It’s not too busy inside, and as soon as Tony enters his nostrils are assaulted by the strong smell of plant.

  • He isn’t really much of a plant or flower person, but he knows he has to do something to make up for being late again.

  • He walks around for a bit, conscious of the time, and finally settles on grabbing the nearest bouquet of red roses he can find.

  • He gets to the counter to pay for his flowers, and he is met with the most gorgeous deep brown eyes he has ever seen.

  • It takes him aback; fuck this boy is pretty.

  • The cashier - Peter, as his name badge suggests - is making up a bouquet of flowers, and Tony stares at how his slender fingers move so expertly, how his hands are so steady, how his-

  • “Hello, Sir.  How can I help you today?” Peter asks brightly, breaking Tony out of his staring.

  • Tony wants to get to know him.  No, he needs to.  He eyes Peter up and down and smiles charmingly.  “The bouquet you just made up.  Is it for sale?”

  • Peter glances from Tony to his newly-made bouquet and smiles.  “Yeah,” he says.  “Sure.  It’s $15.”

  • Tony hums and nods.  “I’ll take them.  And these,” he says, placing the roses on the counter.

  • “Of course, Sir,” Peter says, keying things into the till and then carefully picking up his hand-made bouquet and placing it on the counter for Tony.  “Very lucky someone you’ve got at home.”

  • “Oh yeah,” Tony agrees.  “Very lucky.”

  • “That’ll be 24.99 altogether,” Peter says, smiling so sweetly at Tony that Tony thinks his heart might explode.

  • Tony pulls out a 50 dollar bill and hands it to Peter.  “Keep the change,” he says softly. 

  • Peter stares at Tony in shock, which makes Tony smile.  Just as Peter’s about to protest, Tony puts his hand up and cuts in.  “Please, Peter,” he says, watching the boy blush at the use of his name.  “Keep the change.  For the effort of having to make the bouquet.”

  • “Th-thank you.  That’s really nice of you, Sir,” Peter says, cheeks still rosy.  “Let me get your receipt.”

  • “Of course.”

  • When Peter hands the receipt to Tony, Tony pulls a pen out of the pocket of his suit and writes his phone number down on the paper.  He then takes the roses in one hand and slides Peter’s bouquet back across the counter towards Peter.

  • “For you,” Tony grins.  “The most beautiful flowers I’ve ever seen for the most beautiful man I’ve ever seen.”  He slides the receipt across to a blushing, stuttering Peter and winks.  “And now you’ve got my number.  Your move.”

  • “Sir, I-”

  • “-Call me Tony.  Tony Stark,” Tony says with a smile.  “It was lovely meeting you, Peter.  I hope to hear from you soon?” With that, Tony walks towards the door of the shop, feeling thoroughly elated.

  • “Yes, Mr Stark.  You- You will!” he hears Peter call after him.  

  • All in all, a pretty successful day.  And a good reason to be late.
